name: Kenya
introduction: Founding president and liberation struggle icon Jomo KENYATTA led Kenya from independence in 1963 until his death in 1978 when President Daniel MOI took power in a constitutional succession. The country was a de facto one-party state from 1969 until 1982 when the ruling Kenya African National Union (KANU) made itself the sole legal party in Kenya. MOI acceded to internal and external pressure for political liberalization in late 1991. The ethnically fractured opposition failed to dislodge KANU from power in elections in 1992 and 1997 which were marred by violence and fraud but were viewed as having generally reflected the will of the Kenyan people. President MOI stepped down in December 2002 following fair and peaceful elections. Mwai KIBAKI running as the candidate of the multiethnic united opposition group the National Rainbow Coalition (NARC) defeated KANU candidate Uhuru KENYATTA and assumed the presidency following a campaign centered on an anticorruption platform. KIBAKI's NARC coalition splintered in 2005 over a constitutional review process. Government defectors joined with KANU to form a new opposition coalition the Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) which defeated the government's draft constitution in a popular referendum in November 2005. KIBAKI's reelection in December 2007 brought charges of vote rigging from ODM candidate Raila ODINGA and unleashed two months of violence in which as many as 1500 people died. African Union-sponsored mediation led by former UN Secretary General Kofi ANNAN in late February 2008 resulted in a power-sharing accord bringing ODINGA into the government in the restored position of prime minister. The power sharing accord included a broad reform agenda the centerpiece of which was constitutional reform. In August 2010 Kenyans overwhelmingly adopted a new constitution in a national referendum. The new constitution introduced additional checks and balances to executive power and significant devolution of power and resources to 47 newly created counties. It also eliminated the position of prime minister following the first presidential election under the new constitution which occurred on 4 March 2013. Uhuru KENYATTA the son of founding president Jomo KENYATTA won the March elections in the first round by a close margin and was sworn into office on 9 April 2013.
overview: 'Kenya is a country in East Africa with coastline on the Indian Ocean. It encompasses savannah lakelands the dramatic Great Rift Valley and mountain highlands. It''s also home to wildlife like lions elephants and rhinos. From Nairobi the capital safaris visit the Maasai Mara Reserve known for its annual wildebeest migrations and Amboseli National Park offering views of Tanzania''s 5895m Mt. Kilimanjaro.'

languages.name: Ta'izzi-Adeni Arabic
languages.area: All provinces except the 2 east and the northeast ones. Probably a few in United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia. Also in Djibouti, Egypt, Eritrea, Kenya, Libya, Somalia, United Kingdom.

languages.name: Omani Arabic
languages.area: Mainly in Hajar Mountains highlands; a few coastal regions. Also in Djibouti, Kenya, Tanzania, United Arab Emirates.

languages.name: Hadrami Arabic
languages.area: Hadramaut. Also in Eritrea, Kenya.

languages.name: Bengali
languages.area: West. Also in Canada, India, Malawi, Nepal, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Burji
languages.area: South of Lake Ciamo. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Aweer
languages.area: Coast Province, behind Lamu, and Tana River districts in forests; North-Eastern Province, Garissa District. 11 villages or more. Also in Somalia.

languages.name: Bukusu
languages.area: Western Province, Bungoma District, Mt. Elgon.

languages.name: Cutchi-Swahili
languages.area: Also in Tanzania.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Chonyi-Dzihana-Kauma
languages.area: Coast Province, Kilifi District.

languages.name: Chuka
languages.area: Eastern Province, South Meru District.

languages.name: Dahalo
languages.area: Coast Province, Lamu and Tana River districts, near Tana River mouth.

languages.name: Taita
languages.area: Coast Province, Taita District, Taita hills.

languages.name: Digo
languages.area: Coast Province, Kwale District, south of Mombasa. Also in Tanzania.

languages.name: Daasanach
languages.area: Lower Omo River, along Lake Turkana, into Kenya. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Duruma
languages.area: Coast Province, West Kwale District, south of Mombasa to Tanzania border.

languages.name: Embu
languages.area: Eastern Province, Embu District.

languages.name: El Molo
languages.area: Eastern Province, Marsabit District, Lake Turkana southeast shore, Elmolo Bay.

languages.name: Markweeta
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Elgeyo Marakwet District.

languages.name: Keiyo
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Elgeyo Marakwet District.

languages.name: French
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Guadeloupe, Guinea, Haiti, India, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Libya, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Mali, Martinique, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mayotte, Monaco, Morocco, Mozambique, New Caledonia, Niger, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Réunion, Rwanda, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Seychelles, South Africa, Switzerland, Togo, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Vanuatu, Wallis and Futuna.

languages.name: Borana-Arsi-Guji Oromo
languages.area: South Oromo region. Also in Kenya, Somalia.

languages.name: Garre
languages.area: Mostly south, especially Wanle Weyn-Buur Hakaba; Baydhaba, Dhiinsoor, Buurhakaba, and Qoryooley districts; Middle and Lower Shabeelle and Bay regions.

languages.name: Goan Konkani
languages.area: South coast strip of Maharashtra, Ratnagari District; Goa; Karnataka; Kerala. Also in Kenya, United Arab Emirates.

languages.name: Gujarati
languages.area: Gujarat; Maharashtra; Rajasthan; Karnataka; Madhya Pradesh. Also in Bangladesh, Botswana, Canada, Fiji, Kenya, Malawi, Mauritius, Mozambique, Oman, Pakistan, Réunion, Singapore, South Africa, Tanzania, Uganda, United Kingdom, United States, Zambia, Zimbabwe.

languages.name: Gusii
languages.area: Nyanza Province, Kisii District, south of Kavirondo Gulf. Also in Tanzania.

languages.name: Hindi
languages.area: Throughout north India: Delhi; Uttar Pradesh; Uttarakhand; Rajasthan; Punjab; Madhya Pradesh; northern Bihar; Himachal Pradesh. Also in Bangladesh, Belize, Bhutan, Botswana, Canada, Djibouti, Germany, Kenya, Nepal, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, South Africa, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, Yemen, Zambia.

languages.name: Idakho-Isukha-Tiriki
languages.area: Western Province, Kakamega District.

languages.name: Ik
languages.area: Northeast Karamoja.

languages.name: Kamba (Kenya)
languages.area: South central, Eastern Province, Machakos and Kitui districts; Coast Province, Kwale District.

languages.name: Makonde
languages.area: Mtwara region, primarily Mtwara Urban, Mtwara Rural, Tandahomba, and Newala districts. Also in Mozambique.

languages.name: Kachhi
languages.area: Gujarat, Rann of Kachchh Area; Andhra Pradesh; Madhya Pradesh; Uttar Pradesh; Assam; Kerala; Tamil Nadu; Maharashtra; Karnataka; Orissa. Also in Kenya, Malawi, Pakistan, Tanzania.

languages.name: Kikuyu
languages.area: West central, Central Province, Kiambu, Murang’a, Nyeri, and Kirinyaga districts.

languages.name: Kuria
languages.area: Mara region, Tarime and Musoma Rural districts, near Kenya border. Some in north Serengeti. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Konso
languages.area: South of Lake Chamo, Sagan River bend. A few migrants in Kenya.

languages.name: Kabras
languages.area: Western Province, Lugari and Kakamega districts.

languages.name: Khayo
languages.area: Western Province, Busia District.

languages.name: Kisa
languages.area: Western Province, Butere-Mumias District.

languages.name: Marachi
languages.area: Western Province, Busia District.

languages.name: Marama
languages.area: Western Province, Butere-Mumias District.

languages.name: Saamia
languages.area: East, Busia District, Kenya border, Lake Victoria is south border. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Tsotso
languages.area: Western Province, Kakamega District.

languages.name: Tachoni
languages.area: Western Province, Lugari and Bungoma districts.

languages.name: Ganda
languages.area: Southeast, primarily Buganda Province, Lake Victoria northwest shore to Lake Kyoga and Tanzania border.

languages.name: Luo (Kenya and Tanzania)
languages.area: Nyanza Province. Also in Tanzania.

languages.name: Wanga
languages.area: Western Province, Butere-Mumias District.

languages.name: Marathi
languages.area: Maharashtra and adjacent states. Also in Canada, Israel, Mauritius, United States.

languages.name: Masai
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Kajiado and Narok districts. Also in Tanzania.

languages.name: Meru
languages.area: Eastern Province, Meru District, northeast of Mt. Kenya.

languages.name: Ilwana
languages.area: Coast Province, Tana River District, Tana River north of Pokomo, between Bura and Garissa.

languages.name: Yaaku
languages.area: Laikipia District, Mukogodo Division, Mukogodo Forest west of Doldol, foothills north of Mt. Kenya.

languages.name: Mwimbi-Muthambi
languages.area: Eastern Province, Central Meru District.

languages.name: Masaaba
languages.area: East, Mbale and Sirinko districts, adjacent to Mount Elgon.

languages.name: Nandi
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Uasin Gishu District, Nandi District.

languages.name: East Nyala
languages.area: Western Province, Lake Victoria area, Kakamega.

languages.name: Nyore
languages.area: Western Province, Kakamega District, above Kavirondo Gulf.

languages.name: Giryama
languages.area: Coast Province, Kilifi and Kwale districts, north of Mombasa.

languages.name: Okiek
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Nakuru District, east Mau Escarpment. Sogoo in Mau Forest south between Amala and Ewas Ng’iro rivers near Nosogami stream. Also in Tanzania.

languages.name: Mochi
languages.area: Northeast corner, Chaga area.

languages.name: Omotik
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Narok District, Lemek area.

languages.name: Orma
languages.area: North Eastern and Coast provinces, Garissa and Tana River districts.

languages.name: Panjabi
languages.area: Punjab, Majhi in Gurdaspur and Amritsar districts, South Firozpur District, Bhatyiana; Rajasthan, north Ganganagar District, Bhatyiana; Haryana; Delhi; Jammu and Kashmir. Also in Bangladesh, Canada, Fiji, Kenya, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Singapore, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Pokomo
languages.area: Coast Province, Tana River District, Upper and Lower Tana River.

languages.name: Pökoot
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Baringo and West Pokot districts. Also in Uganda.

languages.name: Logooli
languages.area: Western Province, Vihiga District. Also in Tanzania.

languages.name: Rendille
languages.area: Eastern Province, Marsabit District, between Lake Turkana and Marsabit Mt.

languages.name: Rundi
languages.area: Also in Rwanda, Tanzania, Uganda.

languages.name: Samburu
languages.area: Samburu District, Lake Baringo south and east shores; Rift Valley Province (Chamus), Baringo District.

languages.name: Segeju
languages.area: Tanga region, Muheza District, narrow strip of northeast coast between Tanga and Kenya border.

languages.name: Kipsigis
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Uasin Gishu District; Nandi District.

languages.name: Sindhi
languages.area: Sindh. Possibly also United Arab Emirates. Also in Canada, India, Oman, Philippines, Singapore, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Somali
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Canada, Djibouti, Ethiopia, Finland, Italy, Kenya, Oman, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, Yemen.

languages.name: Sabaot
languages.area: Western Province, Mt. Elgon District; Rift Valley Province, Trans-Nzoia District.

languages.name: Waata
languages.area: Coast Province, Lamu District, Tana River lower parts.

languages.name: Swahili (Coastal)
languages.area: Zanzibar, coastal areas. Also in Burundi, Canada, Kenya, Libya, Mayotte, Mozambique, Oman, Rwanda, Somalia, South Africa, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United States.

languages.name: Suba
languages.area: Lake Victoria east shore; Mfangano and Rusinga islands.

languages.name: Terik
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Uasin Gishu District; Nandi District.

languages.name: Teso
languages.area: East, Katakwi (mainly), Soroti, Kaberamaido, Kumi, Pallisa, and Tororo districts. Lokathan, Madial area, Nangeya Mountains north end. Also in Kenya.

languages.name: Sagalla
languages.area: Coast Province, Taita District, Taita Hills, Sagala Hill slopes.

languages.name: Tharaka
languages.area: Eastern Province, East Meru District, Embu District; some in Kitui District.

languages.name: Toposa
languages.area: South, Singaita and Lokalyen rivers’ sides. Ritual center at Loyooro River. Migrate to Moruangipi, and farther east for seasonal grazing into Ilemi Triangle at Ethiopia border, but no permanent settlements there.

languages.name: Turkana
languages.area: Rift Valley Province, Turkana, Samburu, Trans-Nzoia, Laikipia, Isiolo districts, west and south of Lake Turkana; Turkwel and Kerio rivers. Also in Ethiopia.

languages.name: Tugen
languages.area: Baringo District north of Nakuru town.

languages.name: Taveta
languages.area: Coast Province, Taita District, Taveta area; Tanzania.

languages.name: Kenyan Sign Language
languages.area: 32 primary schools for the deaf in Hola, Kapsabet, Karatina, Karen, Kerugoya, Kilifi, Kisumu, Kitui, Kwale, Meru, Mombasa, Mumias, Murang’a, Nairobi, Nakuru, North Kinangop, Ruiru, Sakwa. Schools under the Kenya Institute of Education (KIE) use Kenyan version of (American) Exact Signed English, including one at Machakos. KSL used at Nyangoma School at Bondo, a primary and boys’ technical school (Sakwa), and in one girl’s school. A school in Mombasa uses British Sign Language [bfi].

languages.name: Maay
languages.area: South, Gedo region, Middle and Lower Shabeelle, Middle and Lower Jubba, Baay, and Bakool regions. Also in Ethiopia, Kenya, Sudan, United States.
